uncc

Class HSQLDatabaseConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • uncc.HSQLDatabaseConnection

  • public class HSQLDatabaseConnection
extends java.lang.Object

    Simple wrapper class intended to provide high-level access to HyperSQL's Java connector specifically for the database schema utilized in this project.

    Since:
    June 17th, 2015
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Christian Gibson

    • Constructor Detail

      • HSQLDatabaseConnection

        public HSQLDatabaseConnection(java.lang.String dbname)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructor for the HSQLDatabaseConnection object.
        Parameters:
        dbname - English name for the database instance this will provide a connection to.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - In the case that the database cannot be found, or one of the created HSQLDatabaseTable objects encounters an error during instantiation.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllBooks

        public Book[] getAllBooks()
        Get an array of all uncc.objects.Book objects found in our Book table.
        Returns:
        The array of book objects.

      • addNewBook

        public Book addNewBook(Book book)
        Stores an instance of uncc.objects.Book into our Book table.
        Parameters:
        book - The book instance to be stored in the database.
        Returns:
        The book instance as it was stored in the database, with its transient ID field updated to reflect its associated primary key in the database.

      • addNewBook

        public Book addNewBook(java.lang.String isbn)
        Generates a uncc.objects.Book object from an ISBN string, and stores it in our Book table.
        Parameters:
        isbn - The ISBN of the book we want to insert.
        Returns:
        The book instance as it appears in the database.

      • removeBook

        public boolean removeBook(Book book)
        Deletes a uncc.objects.Book instance from our database.
        Parameters:
        book - The book we want to remove from the database.
        Returns:
        True if the book was removed successfully, False otherwise.

      • addNewStudent

        public Student addNewStudent(Student student)
        Adds a uncc.objects.Student instance to the database.
        Parameters:
        student - The student instance we want to add to the database.
        Returns:
        The student object as it appears in the database, with its transient ID field updated to reflect its associated primary key in the database.

      • removeStudent

        public boolean removeStudent(Student student)
        Removes a uncc.objects.Student instance from the database.
        Parameters:
        student - The student instance we want to remove from the database.
        Returns:
        True if the object was removed successfully, False otherwise.

      • addNewRental

        public Rental addNewRental(Student student,
                           Book book)
        Adds a uncc.objects.Rental instance to our database.
        Parameters:
        student - The uncc.objects.Student object that represents the student who is renting a book.
        book - The uncc.objects.Book object that represents the book being rented from the tutoring center.
        Returns:
        A new uncc.objects.Rental object as it appears in the database.

      • removeRental

        public boolean removeRental(Rental rental)
        Removes a uncc.objects.Rental object from the database.
        Parameters:
        rental - The Rental object we want to remove from the database.
        Returns:
        True if the object was removed successfully, False otherwise.

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Returns:
        The java.sql.Connection object used to connect to our central database instance.
